results.content: So far so good. There's no explanation just step by step which is fine for me as that's literally what I was looking for but if somebody has never written HTML/CSS/PHP/JS before, they might want to take a course on that first.

results.content:
I really loved this course. Learning how a messenger app works is not only interesting but teaches you the basics of how to communicate with a database/server via php. It is was refreshing to have a course only last 1 hour but still have meaningful content. A lot of the courses on Udemy last hours upon hours and it can be hard to stay focused. 

My only bit of advice would be to take more time in explaining some of the concepts. But again, I liked that this course was short and to the point.

Thank you!

results.content:
The course is very short and quite fast. The chat app works in the end and it is a possible project to learn how to build a basic PHP app.
The code used does however not follow best practice as there are repetitions in the code which can cause problems later.
The explenations are generally very basic and require further research in many cases.
results.content_html:

results.content:
Suddenly there was code input with no guidance or explanation. Much of the course seemed rushed.

I did learn something interesting, but I feel like this was very incomplete. It seemed almost like a whole video was missing.
I actually ended up getting a bit frustrated, and eventually just looked up some items online.

I will try another course from Akram as he seems to be trying and is not doing a bad job, just room for improvement.

I would recommend spending a bit more time explaining what you are doing and what effect it will have. Much of this course was "just do what I do" kind of instruction.

results.content:

Though it requires some basic to start. I have figured out everything by re-doing with some organization and commenting each part for myself. Carry on Akram.
